item.title: PowerShell – Batch Convert URLs to PDF
item.description:
There are lots and lots of articles on the web describing how to save a whole webpage as PDF. They all use, more or less, the browser’s ability to print to PDF.

I needed to convert many URLs at once. Doing that manually for every URL would have been cumbersome, and that’s why I automated the process.

item.title: Introducing vlDeploy - Deploy Applications With PowerShell Remotely
item.description:
Managing applications on Windows in enterprises is complex and cumbersome. Admins are using a variety of tools to install, uninstall or reconfigure applications silently. The most popular tool is propably Microsoft’s ConfigMgr.

While ConfigMgr (and others) makes sense for mid to large enterprises, the management is too time-consuming for smaller firms. I work in such a smaller firm. We have a lab to test our own applications uberAgent on several operating systems. These lab machines don’t only run uberAgent, of course, they also run standard applications like text editors, browsers, and more complex things.
